description: Porsche 930 Turbo 1983 3.3 ltr Matching Numbers

This is a 1983 Porsche 930 (911) Turbo. The car is in very beautiful condition with excellent sutures. The car has the original colour combination Zinn Metallic with a black interior. The 3.3 ltr engine is Matching numbers. In 2007 this engine was revised and has driven 20.000 miles since then. Ofcourse the Porsche Geburtsurkune is present.

PHS Documented (242) GTO, factory Barrier blue metallic, all new parchment interior, 400 ci engine, factory tri-power carbs, factory Muncie 4 speed manual transmission, factory intake manifold, HO exhaust manifolds, chrome air cleaners & valve covers, power steering, power brakes, aluminum radiator with shroud, bucket seats with console, Hurst shifter, factory Sport wood wheel, factory Rally dash with tach & gauges, am radio, 2 1/2" Flowmaster dual exhaust, 12 bolt 3.56 Safe-T-Track rear end, G70-14 Firestone Wide Oval bias ply redlines, 14" Rally I wheels, redline spare, 83,000 original miles, GR-RRR!

This rare 1973 911T Targa was special-ordered and delivered to Central Porsche/Audi in Wichita, Kansas. The original owner kept the car for 39 years before selling to its' 2nd owner and has confirmed the history and details on this special 911.  The exterior light yellow paint is original abet a touch up from the neighbor kids bike when a few months old. That this 911 has covered only 82,000 miles in all these years confirms its exceptional condition. While the front seats had the proper hounds tooth inserts, they were showing some wear; so we installed new inserts to complement the rest of the original interior. This car comes with extensive documentation, including the original window sticker.  It was special ordered with many options (see below), including the Sportomatic transmission which is extremely rare and performs flawlessly, think of it as a clutches manual.  When you place your hand on the shifter, the clutch engages and you manually shift gears – the forerunner to the new PDK. The air conditioning, S Splitter and fog lights are all factory installed and on the original window sticker!  This is a rare opportunity to acquire a ''no stories'' early 911 with some very cool options in is original paint.–

Original frame off, Numbers matching, 409 375HP 4 speed Super Sport.  3:08 postive traction rear, dual stainless exhaust, power steering, factory tachometer.  Original southern car sold new in Richmond, Va. A beautiful car, great color combination and a joy to drive.

This is a 1960 Triumph TR3A in marvellous condition. The combination of the colour British Racing Green with black interior and chrome wire wheels is really great. The car also has overdrive, chrome luggagerack and an extra cooling fan.

1965 Chevrolet Corvette Stingray convertible L-78,

one of 2157 L-78 big blocks,  This original 396ci 425hp was restored to create the ultimate high performance driver offering safety, handling, and performance, rivaling todays cars while retaining the classic beauty of the mid year corvette. While many upgrades were made the desired cosmetic goal was achieved with the original color combinations of nassau blue exterior and  medium blue AL Knoch leather seating with a premium white convertible top. The original 396 engine was removed for a complete high performance build by Mark Small, where quality parts, Diamond shelf custom pistons, Bullet cam and lifters, Comp springs, King rod and main bearings, Edeibrock aluminum heads and intake manifold, MSD electronic ignition, and hooker headers were utilized to provide a powerfull yet extremely dependible power plant. Dyno Testing at well over 500hp the package was fitted with a high performance clutch, pressure plate and flywheel. The clutch assy. is activated by a keisler hydraulic unit that handles the torque comfortably, assuring a smooth engagement with the tremac 5speed transmission. Dynamically balanced drive shafts coupled to a 3:70 positraction rear axle allow highway cruising at less than 2000 rpm. The cooling system uses a 2500 cfm electric fan and a F.A.S.T. aluminum radiator to provide 180 degrees or less with the air conditioning functioning. Braking is accomplished with four wheel disc brakes thru a Hydro-Boost system insuring firm straight stops. Power steering is accomplished with a Borg Quick ratio unit. in conjunction with an Ididit tilt adjustable steering column. Vintage air provides the very efficient air conditioning and Built in front and rear radar detectors give smokey away. This stingray is perfectly alligned, tracking straight and true. The ultimate driver with the classic mid year look.
FERRARI 308 GTB (VETRORESINA), 1977
RIGHT HAND DRIVE: UK SUPPLIED: 1 OF ONLY 158 CARS PRODUCED
THREE OWNERS: 37,800 MILES: LONG TERM OWNERSHIP 33+ YEARS

Officially introduced at the Paris Salon in October 1975, the 308 GTB's styling was created by Pininfarina's Leonardo Fioravanti, who had been responsible for some of Ferrari's most celebrated shapes to date such as the Daytona, the Dino and the Berlinetta Boxer. The stunning two seat coachwork was all new, but incorporated all of the old magic by blending aspects of the Dino 246GT with the later 365 GT4/BB. Reminiscent of the Boxer was the dihedral groove at bumper level splitting top and bottom, the plunging nose and the sail panels reaching back to meet a shallower spoiler, while the conical side air intakes and recessed concave rear window were familiar from the Dino. The 308 GTB employed a tubular steel chassis with independent coil spring/wishbone suspension front and rear, complimented by anti-roll bars, adjustable dampers and powerful disc

At its heart was a Formula One derived, all alloy, four camshaft 3.0 litre V8 engine, allied to a transversely mounted five-speed gearbox. The very first 308 GTB's (Vetroresina) produced were the fastest and best handling thanks to a fibreglass body that weighed substantially less than the steel coachwork models that replaced these original lightweight models. Also, the first cars also featured the highly desired race-bred dry sump lubrication.

Rolling off the Ferrari production line in 1976, our ultra-rare fibreglass, dry sump car; (the only ones given Group 4 homologation for competition)  20689, was delivered new to the UK and is one of only 154 right hand drive models produced. Supplied new via Maranello Concessionaires Ltd on the 15th February 1977 to Mr Graham Priaulx of St. Martins, Guernsey.

Commissioned to be built to the following specification: Exterior: Rosso Metallizzato (133-R-10) with factory options, Air Conditioning and Metallic Paint. We have been informed by Ferrari S.p.A that this example is one of only four cars supplied to the UK in this very desirable and rare colour.

The second keeper Mr D.A Bisson, also a Channel Islands resident, acquired the Ferrari on the 25th June 1982 and remained in the family's private car collection ever since; some 33+ years! On Hexagon Classics acquisition, we commenced a through and detailed restoration works that included, complete repaint in the correct manufactured colour specification Rosso Metallizato, complete re trim in Nero Hide and Nero Wilton carpets, complete mechanical preparation with official Ferrari Classiche service agent, The Issuance of Classiche by Ferrari S.p.A

We are proud to offer for sale this highly collectable are rare motorcar that has covered only 37,800 miles with three registered keepers from new, complete with chassis file: original leather pouch and handbook, original buff log book, various maintenance invoices, original Ferrari S.p.A order documents.

The GTB Vetroresina is the most desirable version of Ferrari's iconic 308, being a genuine UK delivered right hand drive example, (only 158 supplied) together with being just one of four examples produced in Rosso Metallizato. This a unique opportunity to acquire one of the most highly regarded contemporary models produced by Modena and a fantastic investment opportunity for the future.
Available to view now at our London showrooms.
Something very rare: a 1
from BMW's ‘neue Klasse' (new class)

This car was built in 1968 at the BMW Plant in Munich. A bit later it was delivered to Italian BMW importer BMW Italia S.p.A. It was delivered in BMW 060 Polaris silver Metallic with a blue Interior. We have recently acquired this car from Italy. From Mr. Paolo Airoldi, from Dazio, Sondrio, Italy. The car was always in the Airoldi family and now comes from the 2nd owner.

This 1968 model still has the beautiful dashboard from the 1st series. The car makes  a beautiful original impression. This car has'nt been restored. The interior is beautifully clean and original. The original doorpanels, dashboard (crackfree) and the beautiful early instruments. Seats, headliner and carpets are still the originals from 1968 and clean, nice and original. Beautiful, unchanged, unmolested and unrestored. A time travel to 1968.

The BMW's of the New class, the 4- and 2-doors have saved the BMW brand and made it what it is today. In the beginning of 1966 the 2000 version of the 4-door was introduced to the market. There were some slight changes against the older BMW 1800. The round headlights were replaced with rectangular headlights as well was bigger taillights. The 2000 had the biggest and engine was the best driveable of them all.

The 2000 we're offering is a nice and solid, honest body. We haven't found any rust and the car has a nice and straight body in the original color Polaris silver. The paint is very nice and the shutlines and panels match up. Also the trim parts are very nice. Trim, chrom bumpers, mirrors, blinkers and lights are in a nice and good shape.

The enginebay is very clean too, original und non-restored. In the engine bay lies the original, matching numbers 2,0L unit. The car recently had a new battery, sparkplugs, cap, rotor, points and condensator. The engine runs nice and smooth, the 4-speed gearbox shifts easy. This car can be driven right away.
The originality continues in the trunk. There is the original spare wheel in a very original trunk with all original spotwelds and seamseals.
The car has recently been imported from Italy by us from the 2nd owner.

This 1963 Carrera II Cabriolet was purchased by Roy Stantz in Chicago Illinois in 1963 and has lived the good life ever since. Almost 15 years later, this special Cabriolet showed up in a red/tan color combination at the 1987 356 Holiday in Estes Park Colorado, where it won ''Best of Show'' for Dr. Larry Tree. The Tree's followed up with another a win in the ''Special Production'' category at the Porsche Parade, which solidified what a truly remarkable 356 they had. In the following year, famed Porsche collector, Charlie Hunter, obtained the car and it remained hidden in the mountains of Virginia, idle for two more decades until we purchased it in 2008. While the car was kept in exceptional condition, the factory Kardex revealed that it was a Paint-to-Sample ''Condor Yellow'' exterior with a Black interior. We were excited to see the Kardex, and knew that a whole lot of work was ahead of us when the fastidious client that we sold it to said, ''Great, now restore it''! At that moment, this 1963 Carrera II Cabriolet became our very first restoration project. Upon disassembly, we hit the lottery! We found one dent, that's it, a single dent! All of the sheet metal was original, the battery pan, floor pan, all of it... The trim and hard to find items were all there, with virtually no repo parts. The engine and transmission are numbers-matching units and only needed to be fine-tuned upon re-installation. This Cabriolet presented itself as the ultimate wish list as far as restorations go. Since its completion, this award winner has been shown a couple of times; adding to its list of accolades, the 2008 Porsche Parade Zuffenhausen Award, but has primarily sat on display as part of a 356 soft top collection. We are very proud to offer one of the finest 356 Carrera II's on the planet, in a one of a kind color.

seller_name: Autosport Designs Inc - Lotus Motorcars of Long Island
title: 1998 Porsche RUF Turbo R

description: 1998 RUF PORSCHE 911/993 TURBO R:
--Oak Green with Black leather interior and Black carpeting, Originally built by RUF for a member of the Porsche family, 35,000 miles, 6-speed manual, 520 HP.

This RUF Turbo R was built for Porsche family member, Dr. Ferdinand Oliver Porsche as per documentation from RUF Automobiles as well as Dr. Porsche himself to the previous owner.  It was built to the following specifications: Oak Green/Black, RUF 19” wheels, RUF Integrated Roll Cage, RUF Sport Seats, RUF Floor Mats (RUF logo in Yellow), RUF Yellow Brake Calipers, RUF Pedal Set, RUF Short Shift Knob, RUF Steering Wheel, RUF Front and Rear Bumper, RUF Doorsills, RUF Instruments.

The RUF 993 Turbo R is created when 400 HP from the standard 993 Turbo is just not enough!  Starting from a standard 1998 993 Turbo this Turbo has been treated to Porsche Tuning specialist RUF's Turbo R upgrades.  Upgrades include engine and suspension changes.  The engine has been converted to full Turbo R 520 HP spec using re-programmed ECU, upgraded KKK turbos, full sports exhaust, cylinder head revisions, new re-profiled camshafts as well as an RS spec flywheel (rather than the standard dual mass item).   The suspension has been uprated with a height adjustable kit from H&R to offer superb road holding and performance handling.  Other than sitting approximately 30mm lower than standard, you'd be forgiven for thinking the car was almost standard until it's started.  A quick twist of the key brings a glorious sound booming from the tailpipes.

Ruf figures give 0-100kph (62mph) in just 3.6 secs with a top speed of over 200mph.  The RUF product delivers its horsepower in a docile manner that is a pleasure around town, but once your foot eases the pedal to the floor and the rpm's rise the turbos start to make their presence known.  There is no turbo lag, in fact the power simply builds up rather like an extremely torquey normally aspirated engine.  Keep your right foot planted over 4000rpm and the car changes from a merely fast car to brutally fast as you feel the effects of 535 lb-ft of torque pushing down the road very, very, quickly!

This RUF Turbo R package has performance even outclassing the legendary 959.  This could possibly be the ultimate last generation air-cooled 911! Having been built specifically for the Porsche family when new, this Turbo R's provenance is simply second to none.

The color combinations on this X-Type are incredible! The Adriatic Blue is a hard to find color that has maintained its deep, rich and high gloss like the day it left the factory and the laser straight lines show the great and unique design of this Jag. 16" 5-Spoke Aluminum Alloys mounted on deep-tread Hankook tires completes this great exterior look. The interior is total Jaguar luxury with Premium Sand Leather seating that is so soft and supple and is rip, tear and stain free. The dashboard has been designed to be user friendly for the many options and features making any trip, long or short a total pleasure. This is one amazing X-Type. With no interior smokers odors we assume that the previous owner was a non-smoker.

This X-Type is loaded with options and features for your driving pleasure. Ice Cold Automatic Climate Control System, 8-Way Power Drivers and Passenger Power Bucket Seats, Rear Parking Aid, Premium Package, All-Wheel Drive, Power Moonroof, Alpine Premium Audio System with CD Player & Changer, 16" 5-Spoke Aluminum Wheels mounted on Deep-Tread Hankook Tires, Premium Leather Seating, Auto

Dimming Rearview Mirror, Universal Garage Door Opener, Driver and Passenger Adjustable Lumbar Support, Pass-Through Rear Seat, Rain-Sensing Windshield Wipers, Rear Window Defroster, Power Heated Outside Mirrors, Front and Rear Fog Lights, Vehicle Security System w/Audible Verification, Cruise Control, One-Touch Down Power Windows, Power Door Locks, Leather Wrapped Steering Wheel, Tilt & Telescopic Steering Wheel with Audio & Speed Control, Center Console with Stowage, Carfax Certified, Florida Salt-Free, Only 42,481 Documented Miles, Maintenence 01/2017 and so much more!

The powertrain combination on this X-Type Sedan is so impressive! The 3.0L, DOHC, SMPI, V6 engine in harmony with its 5-Speed Automatic Transmission with Overdrive will deliver all of the power and all of the performance that you would ever need. Your safety and Jaguar go hand-in-hand. Driver and Passenger Front Airbags, Driver and Passenger Side-Impact Airbags, 4-Wheel Anti-Lock Braking System, Driver and Passenger Side-Impact Head Protection Airbags, Power Four-Wheel Disc Brakes with Electronic Brake Distribution, Jaguar "Traction 4" Full-Time All-Wheel-Drive w/40/60 Front and Rear Torque Split, Front & Rear Fog Lamps and so much more for the safety and the well being of you and all of your loved ones.

PODIUM AUTO has an amazing sales record of delivering over 71% of all of our sales sight unseen! This accomplishment was achieved by our world-wide reputation for honesty and integrity. We deliver incredible, solid and safe vehicles from California to Dubai. This Jaguar X-Type Sedan is another example of what to expect when you purchase a PODIUM AUTO vehicle.

MERCEDES-BENZ SLR MCLAREN ROADSTER, LHD 2010
MILEAGE:- 3,700 MILES ONLY, UK SUPPLIED
CRYSTAL LAURITE SILVER METALLIC WITH BLACK EXCLUSIVE LEATHER

FACTORY SPECIFICATION INCLUDES:- AMG SPEEDSHIFT R TRANSMISSION, SILVER ARROW PACKAGE, EXTRA LARGE SPECIFICATION DRIVER'S SEAT, GREY FABRIC ELECTRIC FOLDING HOOD, 19” 9-HOLE TURBINE ALLOYS,  GARAGE DOOR OPENER, CLIMATE CONTROL, ELECTRIC WINDOWS, CENTRAL LOCKING, BRAKE SYSTEM FOR 19” ALLOYS, BI-XENON HEADLAMPS, CD CHANGER.

Hexagon Classics are pleased to offer one of the most iconic modern roadsters.  The Mercedes-Benz SLR McLaren roadster is a grand tourer jointly developed by Mercedes-Benz and McLaren Automotive, built in Portsmouth and the McLaren Technology Centre in Woking, Surrey, England and was sold from 2003 to 2010.

When it was developed, German manufacturer Mercedes-Benz owned 40 percent of the McLaren Group. SLR stands for "Sport Leicht Rennsport" (Sport Light Racing), and serves as an homage to the Mercedes-Benz 300 SLR which was the McLaren's inspiration.

The SLR features Sensotronic Brake Control, a brake-by-wire system. The brake discs are carbon-ceramic and provide better stopping power and fade resistance than steel discs when operating under ideal working temperature. Mercedes-Benz claims the discs are fade resistant to 1,200 °C (2,200 °F). The front discs are internally vented and 370 mm diameter eight-piston calipers are used. Rear discs are 360 mm in diameter with four-piston calipers. During wet conditions the calipers automatically skim the surface of the discs to dry them.

The SLR sports a 232-kg hand-built 5,439 cc), supercharged, all-aluminium, SOHC, V8 engine. The cylinders are angled at 90 degrees with 3 valves per cylinder and lubricated via a dry sump system. The compression ratio is 8.8:1 and the bore and stroke is 97 mm × 92 mm The Lysholm-type twin-screw supercharger rotates at 23,000 rpm and produces 0.9 bar of boost. The compressed air is then cooled via two intercoolers. The engine generates a maximum power of 617 hp at 6,500 rpm and maximum torque of 780 Nm/580 lbft, at 3,250 to 5,000 rpm. The SLR uses AMG Speedshift R five-speed automatic transmission with three manual modes. The roadster version of the SLR went on sale in September 2007. It used the same supercharged V8 AMG engine as its coupé siblings, which propels it to a top speed of 208 mph) and a 0 to 62 mph acceleration time of 3.1 seconds.

Our car was supplied by SLR Centre of Excellence, Brooklands, in August 2010, and they subsequently carried out 5 services, the most recent of which was July 2017 at 3614 miles. The original SLR handbook pack is complete, and the SLR roadster is ready to be enjoyed.
Available to view now at our London showrooms.
